title: Physciaceae
text:
The Physciaceae are a <a href="family%20%28taxonomy%29">family</a> of mostly <a href="lichen">lichen</a>-forming <a href="fungus">fungi</a> belonging to the <a href="class%20%28taxonomy%29">class</a> <a href="Lecanoromycetes">Lecanoromycetes</a> in the <a href="division%20%28mycology%29">division</a> <a href="Ascomycota">Ascomycota</a>. Many members of this family are known as shadow lichens. A 2016 estimate placed 19 <a href="genera">genera</a> and 601 species in the family.
Genera.
This is a list of the genera contained within the Physciaceae, based on a 2020 review and summary of ascomycete classification. Following the genus name is the <a href="taxonomic%20authority">taxonomic authority</a>, year of publication, and the number of species:
The genus "<a href="Culbersonia">Culbersonia</a>", previously classified in the Physciaceae due to its morphological features, has been shown with <a href="molecular%20phylogenetics">molecular phylogenetics</a> to belong to the <a href="Caliciaceae">Caliciaceae</a>.
